alert.note: Alert for Harrison (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 17 at 5:30PM CDT by NWS Kansas City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Harrison County through 615 PM CDT... At 530 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Bethany, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Bethany, Ridgeway, New Hampton and Mount Moriah. This includes Interstate 35 in Missouri between mile markers 86 and 99. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for north central and northwestern Missouri.
